benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/tags - Retrieve invoice item tags

covered: Valid Request: Multiple success paths including minimal params, includedDeleted, audit=FULL/MINIMAL, and combined options return HTTP 200 with Tag schema validation.
Empty Response: Explicit scenario returns HTTP 200 with an empty JSON array when no tags exist.
Query Parameters: Broad coverage of valid/invalid values, missing required accountId, extra unexpected params, and combined optional params.
Path/Resource Validation: 400 for invalid UUID formats; 404 for non-existent invoice item and account.
Authorization: 401 when authentication token is missing/invalid.
Robustness/Security: SQL injection and XSS payloads are handled without leaking data; invalid values produce proper errors.
Operational/Resilience: Backend service unavailable returns 503; integration with audit logging covered (available/unavailable); regression for deleted tags.
Performance: Normal and peak load scenarios assert acceptable response times.
Boundary IDs: Max/min UUID length edge cases covered.
Pagination: Not applicable for this endpoint (no pagination parameters in spec).
gaps: Default Parameter Behavior: No explicit test that includedDeleted defaults to false (deleted tags excluded when omitted).
Audit Default: No explicit test for audit omitted or audit=NONE verifying absence of audit fields; case sensitivity/whitespace handling not covered.
Association Validation: No scenario where both invoice item and account exist but are not associated, asserting expected 400/404.
Produces/Content Negotiation: Response headers (Content-Type: application/json) not validated; no test for Accept negotiation or 406 behavior (if applicable).
Caching Behavior: No tests for ETag/If-None-Match, Cache-Control, or 304 Not Modified flows.
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No scenarios for burst traffic leading to 429 or validating X-RateLimit/Retry-After headers.
Authorization 403: No coverage for forbidden access when token is valid but lacks permissions (if the API distinguishes 401 vs 403).
Error Contract: Error response body/schema consistency (code/message fields) not asserted across 4xx/5xx responses.
Schema Consistency Across Cases: Tag schema is only explicitly validated in one success scenario; not consistently asserted in others.
recommendations: Add a scenario where the invoice item has both active and deleted tags and includedDeleted is omitted or set to false; assert only active tags are returned.
Add tests for audit default behavior: omit audit and set audit=NONE; verify no audit fields are present. Consider tests for case sensitivity and trimming for audit values.
Add a scenario where accountId does not belong to the invoice item though both exist; clarify and assert expected 400 or 404.
Validate response headers: assert Content-Type is application/json and optionally test Accept header negotiation/behavior.
Introduce caching tests: capture ETag/Last-Modified on first GET and validate 304 with If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since; verify Cache-Control directives.
Cover rate limiting: send burst requests to trigger 429 (if enabled) and validate X-RateLimit-* and Retry-After headers.
Add an authorization test for 403 Forbidden if role-based access applies, distinguishing it from 401 Unauthorized.
Assert a standard error response schema across all error scenarios (fields like errorCode, message, type, requestId).
Extend schema validation to all success paths (includedDeleted, audit FULL/MINIMAL/none) to ensure consistent Tag object contract.
